sentText: Dorothy Garrett Smith ( c. 1932 – August 8 , 1990 ) was the first woman to have served as president of the Louisiana Board of Elementary and Secondary Education , which establishes and monitors education policy .
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] Dorothy Garrett Smith ( c . 1932 – August 8 , 1990 ) was the first woman to have served as president of the Louisiana Board of Elementary and Secondary Education , which establishes and monitors education policy . [SEP]

entityMentions.wordpieceText: the Louisiana Board of Elementary and Secondary Education
entityMentions.label: ORG

sentText: Smith was the president from December 1989 until her sudden death eight months later during the administration of Governor Buddy Roemer .
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] Smith was the president from December 1989 until her sudden death eight months later during the administration of Governor Buddy Roe ##mer . [SEP]

sentText: She represented nine parishes in northwestern Louisiana : Beauregard , Bossier , Caddo , Claiborne , DeSoto , Red River , Sabine , Vernon , and her own Webster .
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] She represented nine parishes in northwestern Louisiana : Beau ##regard , Boss ##ier , C ##ad ##do , C ##lai ##borne , De ##S ##oto , Red River , Sabine , Vernon , and her own Webster . [SEP]

sentText: Smith was either a native of Bastrop in Morehouse Parish in northeast Louisiana or Springhill in northernmost Webster Parish near the Arkansas state line .
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] Smith was either a native of Ba ##stro ##p in More ##house Parish in northeast Louisiana or Spring ##hill in northernmost Webster Parish near the Arkansas state line . [SEP]

sentText: According to the " New Orleans Times - Picayune " , she graduated from Springhill High School and attended Southern Arkansas University in Magnolia .
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] According to the " New Orleans Times - Pi ##ca ##yun ##e " , she graduated from Spring ##hill High School and attended Southern Arkansas University in Ma ##gnolia . [SEP]

sentText: However , the " Minden Press - Herald " reported that she did not move to Springhill until 1957 , when she was about twenty - five years of age and therefore would not have graduated from Springhill High School .

sentText: A Democrat , Smith in the summer of 1970 defeated two opponents to win a seat on the Webster Parish School Board , an institution on which she served for the following sixteen years .
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] A Democrat , Smith in the summer of 1970 defeated two opponents to win a seat on the Webster Parish School Board , an institution on which she served for the following sixteen years . [SEP]

sentText: Smith was the parish school board vice - president under presidents Chester Marlon Pope ( 1929 - 1987 ) , a Republican from Cotton Valley and Henry Grady Hobbs ( 1923 - 2012 ) and Robert Edward " Bob " Parker , Jr. ( born September 1948 ) , both from Minden .
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] Smith was the parish school board vice - president under presidents Chester Mar ##lon Pope ( 1929 - 1987 ) , a Republican from Cotton Valley and Henry Grady Hobbs ( 1923 - 2012 ) and Robert Edward " Bob " Parker , Jr . ( born September 1948 ) , both from Mind ##en . [SEP]

sentText: During Smith 's time on the parish board , several school grounds in rural communities were closed to the public for after - school use because of growing vandalism . "
wordpieceSentText: [CLS] During Smith ' s time on the parish board , several school grounds in rural communities were closed to the public for after - school use because of growing van ##dal ##ism . " [SEP]

sentText: As far as we 're spending our money for school improvements ... vandalism is tearing it all down , " Smith said in expressing regret over the need for the new policy , which allows use of the school facilities for pupils only with adult supervision .
